alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 2:53PM MDT until August 05 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North central portions of the East Troublesome burn scar, including CO-125. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 252 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Lake. - This includes the following additional locations... Columbine Lake, rising water in the Colorado River along River Rd, Lower Stillwater Creek, Stillwater Pass, Upper Willow Creek Valley and Middle Willow Creek Valley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
